quotes.quote: Mothers care in volumes of tears and earnestness of prayers and a depth of emotion others cannot fathom.
When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.
Being a mother is an attitude, not a biological relation.
The moment a child is born, the mother is also born. She never existed before. The woman existed, but the mother, never. A mother is something absolutely new.
Mothers hold their children's hands for a short while, but their hearts forever.Â
There will be so many times you feel like you failed. But in the eyes, heart, and mind of your child you are super mom.

Mothers were meant to love us unconditionally, to understand our moments of stupidity, to reprimand us for lame excuses while yet acknowledging our point of view, to weep over our pain and failures as well as cry at our joy and successes, and to cheer us on despite countless start-overs. Heaven knows, no one else will.
A mother's love! O holy, boundless thing! Fountain whose waters never cease to spring!
Motherhood has a very humanizing effect. Everything gets reduced to essentials.

A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden, fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends who rejoice with us in our sunshine desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.
A mother is always the beginning. She is how things begin.
Successful mothers are not the ones that have never struggled, they are the ones that never give up, despite the struggles.
There is no way to be a perfect mother and a million ways to be a good one.

Mothers, I believe, intoxicate us. We idolize them and take them for granted. We hate them and blame them and exalt them more thoroughly than anyone else in our lives. We sift through the evidence of their love, reassure ourselves of their affection and its biological genesis. We can steal and lie and leave and they will love us.
A mother is not a person to lean on, but a person to make leaning unnecessary.

Motherhood brings as much joy as ever, but it still brings boredom, exhaustion, and sorrow too. Nothing else ever will make you as happy or as sad, as proud or as tired, for nothing is quite as hard as helping a person develop his own individuality especially while you struggle to keep your own.
[Motherhood is] the biggest gamble in the world. It is the glorious life force. It's huge and scary - it's an act of infinite optimism.
Mother love is the fuel that enables a normal human being to do the impossible.Â
My mother has always been my emotional barometer and my guidance. I was lucky enough to get to have one woman who truly helped me through everything.
[Motherhood is] â€˜heart-exploding, blissful hysteria.
Only mothers can think of the future â€“ because they give birth to it in their children.Â
By and large, mothers and housewives are the only workers who do not have regular time off. They are the great vacationless class.
Mothers possess a power beyond that of a king on his throne.
Mother - that was the bank where we deposited all our hurts and worries.
Mothers are the people who love us for no good reason. And those of us who are mothers know it's the most exquisite love of all.Â
The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.Â
A mother's love for her child is like nothing else in the world. It knows no law, no pity, it dates all things and crushes down remorselessly all that stands in its path.
Only mothers can think of the future - because they give birth to it in their children.
Mother's love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.Â
Mama was my greatest teacher, a teacher of compassion, love and fearlessness. If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.

Most of all the other beautiful things in life come by twos and threes, by dozens and hundreds. Plenty of roses, stars, sunsets, rainbows, brothers and sisters, aunts and cousins, comrades and friendsâ€”but only one mother in the whole world.
Motherhood: All love begins and ends there.Â
Of all the rights of women, the greatest is to be a mother.
[A] mother is one to whom you hurry when you are troubled.
Mothers were the only ones you could depend on to tell the whole, unvarnished truth.
My mom is a neverending song in my heart of comfort, happiness, and being. I may sometimes forget the words but I always remember the tune.
A mother is the one who fills your heart in the first place.
My mother is a walking miracle.
Biology is the least of what makes someone a mother.
A mother is a person who seeing there are only four pieces of pie for five people, promptly announces she never did care for pie.
A good mother... when you CRY, she CARRIES you; when you are HUNGRY, she will HURRY to feed you; when you are about to SLEEP, she SINGS for you! Long live good mothers! Thank you mama!
Mother is the name for God in the lips and hearts of little children.
A mother is she who can take the place of all others but whose place no one else can take.
Most mothers are instinctive philosophers.
Mother, the ribbons of your love are woven around my heart.Â

Motherhood is a choice you make everyday, to put someone else's happiness and well-being ahead of your own, to teach the hard lessons, to do the right thing even when you're not sure what the right thing isâ€¦and to forgive yourself, over and over again, for doing everything wrong.
There is only one mother in this world who is the best one; the one that every kid has got.
My mother is my root, my foundation. She planted the seed that I base my life on, and that is the belief that the ability to achieve starts in your mind.
Good mothers make all kinds of choices. Making a decision that might sound selfish does not make a woman a bad mother.
Motherhood is the greatest thing and the hardest thing.
